result.execSummary:
Elvin Long was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Elvin Long was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elvin Long

records.addlTxt:
Case Called: 2:24 pm
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher in person.  Defendant appears in custody, in person, and with Atty Adam Fontana in person.
VRCW.  
State notes that the State of CO will not accept the Bond Money; 
Defendant is requesting to Waive Extradition at this time.
COURT goes over colloquy with the Defendant. Defendant wishes to waive Extradition.
Defendant signs the Extradition Form in the presence of the Court at this time. 
Court has reviewed all the documents and makes findings.
Court finds Waiver is being made freely, voluntarily, and intelligently. 
COURT Signs Certificate. 

Adjourned: 2:27 pm

Case Called: 3:02 pm
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher in person.  Defendant appears in custody, in person, and with Atty Adam Fontana in person.
*Date and time set for an Extradition Hearing*
VRCW.  
Reading Waived. 

Matter is Adjourned to later this week- Defendant may be posting the money for the warrant in CO. 
Parties are to review matter later this week. 

DATES:
Review Hearing 04/15/2022 @ 2:45 pm

Adjourned: 3:04 pm
